name: 'Han' Multiple Choice Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: When talking to Donna about the President's economic advisors, who did Josh refer to them as?
options: People that would make Toby smile
questions.explanation:
Punch and Judy.

	After Josh referred to them as the "Punch and Judy", Donna told him that the citizenry would be comforted to know that he thinks of the economic advisors as a puppet show.

questions.text: Did the President read all of the speech Toby and Will wrote that announced Russell as the new Vice President?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Will was having trouble writing an acceptance speech for Vice President Russell's confirmation so he and Toby wrote a speech that said exactly how they felt about Vice President Russell. On the day of the speech, the President had to come up with his own words after seeing what Toby and Will wrote and never deleted from the speech.

questions.text: When Jai Yung Ahn autographed a CD for the President, he actually wrote "I wish to defect" inside the CD cover.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Before leaving the Oval Office, Jai Yung Ahn autographed some CD's for CJ, Leo, and the President. After Ahn and his guards had left, the President told Leo and CJ that he had written "I wish to defect" on the inside of CD cover.

questions.text: When Donna introduced Josh to her aunt and uncle, what did she say their names were?
questions.explanation:
Ted and Barbara.

	Donna was going to take them on a tour of the White House and Josh was going to try to get them into the recital practice.

questions.text: When Josh was making fun of Wisconsin, what did he say the state bird was?
questions.explanation:
Muenster.

	Donna asked Josh not to make any of his cheese jokes when her aunt and uncle arrived so he told her one before they arrived. Josh also said that Wisconsin thinks of rinds as one of the four major food groups.

questions.text: Who said this to CJ? "Didn't she get the bagel memo?"
questions.explanation:
President Bartlet.

	CJ and the others were in the President's office talking about the economy and CJ thought they needed a new vocabulary when talking about the economy. After hearing CJ say that, the President asked her if she got the bagel memo. He had only heard that morning that they were using the word bagel in place of recession.

questions.text: Who told the President what the price of a milk cost?
options: He called a store to find out
questions.explanation:
Charlie.

	During a meeting in the Oval, the President was asked if he knew what the price of milk was. He didn't know. Right before the concert that night, the President asked Charlie to find out what the price of milk cost and Charlie told him without having to look it up.

questions.text: The President told Jai Yung Ahn that he couldn't defect.
questions.explanation:
True.

	During the recital practice, the President talked to Jai Yung Ahn and explained that the government was holding meeting with North Korea and they couldn't afford to mess things up by helping him defect.

questions.text: Who got Congressman Thiele to vote "yeah" for Russell?
questions.explanation:
Ryan.

	When Donna and Josh weren't around, Ryan made a call to Congressman Thiele's office did something (unbeknownst to viewers) that made Congressman Thiele vote for Russell as Vice President. After Josh heard the "yeah" vote from Thiele, he thought he had talked the Congressman into it.

questions.text: Did the agreement between the United States and North Korea go through?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The President told CJ after the concert that North Korea didn't like the size of everyone's flags on the table and called off the meeting for the time being. The agreement was why the President didn't want Jai Yung Ahn to defect.
